page.title: 07COURTLANDS CENTRE
page.content:
This is known by loacls as{Cutland}and was held during Domesday days by{ {Robert de Coteland.}An original longhouse was replaced by a 14th C. manor house which altered greatly in Tudor times. Since 1975 Courtlands has been an Activity Centre run and owned by the family of John Garland.
Nowdays,families and groups go here to do exciting and adventurous activities such as climbing, riding, sailing, canoeing etc.There is an Assault Course, a Sports Centre,fields and Suana.School children also go to the Centre to study Biology,Geology and do Field Studies.
It costs about Â£100 a week to stay at Courtlands plus extra for some activities.
